initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".
stories: Texas police have stationed a reinforced vehicle to breach the cab of a semi-truck stopped on a highway. The driver resisted attempts to halt the vehicle, declining to stop or exit when officers deployed anti-puncture strips. Following the armoured vehicle's forced entry into the cab, authorities placed a tear gas container inside and then removed the driver. Despite the pursuit, authorities remain uncertain about the incident's origin, noting the driver employed evasive driving tactics, rapidly switching lanes and swerving repeatedly. Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez indicated that the driver was possibly impaired, stating, "It seems he was under the influence of something potent."

A reinforced police vehicle has been deployed to forcibly enter the cab of a semi-truck stopped on a highway. Despite attempts to halt the vehicle, the driver refused to stop or exit, even when officers used anti-puncture strips. After breaking into the cab with the armoured vehicle, authorities placed a tear gas device inside and then removed the driver. The motive for the pursuit remains unclear, as the driver employed evasive driving tactics, rapidly changing lanes and swerving repeatedly. Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez suspects the driver may have been under the influence, citing, "It appears they were affected by a powerful substance."

A specially equipped police car has been used to break into a stopped semi-truck on a highway after the driver resisted attempts to stop the vehicle or exit. Despite officers trying to stop the truck, the driver refused to comply, even after they used anti-puncture strips. Once inside the cab, authorities inserted a tear gas device and removed the driver. The reason for the pursuit is unclear, as the driver employed erratic driving techniques, rapidly changing lanes and swerving frequently. The sheriff, Ed Gonzalez, believes the driver may have been intoxicated, suggesting, "It appears they were under the influence of a powerful substance."

The sheriff, Ed Gonzalez, speculated that the driver may have been impaired, suggesting that it appears they were under the influence of a potent substance.
